meanings.definition: To make someone extremely angry or mad.
meanings.sent1: She bemaddened her brother by hiding his favorite toy.
meanings.sent2: The loud noise bemaddened the dog, causing it to bark incessantly.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten bemaddened the old cat by stealing its food.
meanings.sent4: The constant delays in the project bemaddened the team leader.
meanings.sent5: The unfair treatment of the employees bemaddened the entire staff.

meanings.definition: To become extremely angry or mad.
meanings.sent1: He bemaddened quickly when he realized he had been tricked.
meanings.sent2: After waiting for hours, she finally bemaddened at the long line.
meanings.sent3: The toddler bemaddened when his favorite toy was taken away.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds seemed to bemadden the sky before the downpour.
meanings.sent5: The unresolved issue continued to bemadden him throughout the day.
